meanings.definition: Conducting outward or away from something.
meanings.sent1: The river flowed efferents, away from the mountains.
meanings.sent2: She waved goodbye efferents as the train departed.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the cards disappear efferents, out of the hat!
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed efferents through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The balloons floated efferents into the clear blue sky.

meanings.definition: Nerve fibers that carry signals away from the central nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The efferents transmitted signals from the brain to the muscles.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the efferents to understand how messages travel in the body.
meanings.sent3: The efferents in the body are like messengers delivering important information.
meanings.sent4: The efferents acted like busy highways, transporting messages quickly.
meanings.sent5: The efferents are like telephone wires connecting different parts of the body.

meanings.definition: Carrying or conducting something away from a central point.
meanings.sent1: The efferents pathways led away from the main building.
meanings.sent2: The efferents channels dispersed the water to different areas.
meanings.sent3: The efferents roads guided travelers away from the crowded city.
meanings.sent4: The efferents streams flowed outward, away from the source.
meanings.sent5: The efferents branches extended far from the trunk of the tree.
